DOC.brief_summary: Surgical repair of perineal lesions after delivery is frequently associated with pain and discomfort interfering with the normal activities of the puerperium. The aim of this study was to compare perineal skin repair after episiotomy with adhesive glue versus a subcuticular suture, regarding the incidence of pain and wound complications.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Adhesive Glue With Skin Suture for Repair of Episiotomy
DOC.criteria: vaginal delivery episiotomy performed no further perineal or vaginal lesions present previously existing local infections or lesions body mass index > 35 (Kg/m2) severe pulmonary disease collagen disease known immunodeficiency diabetes mellitus immunosuppressive treatment
